javaClass.shortdesc: This class represents the position of a topic within a collection.

javaClassDetail.apiDesc: The TopicNode class provides methods to traverse the collection that contains the topic.

javaMethod.shortdesc: This constructor creates a topic node within a collection.

javaParam.apiDefNote: The collection that should contain the constructed node.
The topic for the constructed node.

javaField.shortdesc: This constant should be passed to determine if the node can be read.
This constant should be passed to determine if the node can be updated.
This field identifies the location of the topic.

javaMethod.shortdesc: This method returns the availability of the node.

javaReturn.apiDefNote: Whether the node is available for the specified operation.

javaParam.apiDefNote: This parameter identifies whether to check availability for reading or writing the node. You should use the READ_OPERATION or WRITE_OPERATION constants to specify the operation.

javaMethod.shortdesc: This method iterates backward over the collection.

javaReturn.apiDefNote: The prior topic node or null if there is no node.

javaException.apiDefNote: The topic node exists but couldn't be accessed.

javaMethodDetail.apiDesc: You can use the method to confirm that the node is available before traversal.

javaMethod.shortdesc: This method iterates forward over the collection.

javaReturn.apiDefNote: The next topic node or null if there is no node.

javaException.apiDefNote: The topic node exists but couldn't be accessed.

javaMethodDetail.apiDesc: You can use the method to confirm that the node is available before traversal.

javaMethod.shortdesc: This method retrieves the content of the topic.
